comments:
"Enterprise application projects" Chapter from "Web Application Development User Guide" says that "When you create an enterprise application project using the workbench, the following key files are automatically created:

META-INF/application.xml
    This file is the deployment descriptor for the enterprise application, as defined in the J2EE specification, that is responsible for associating J2EE modules to a specific EAR file. It is created in the META-INF folder."

But EAR wizard doesn't do it actually the leads to deployment error, for example, during deploying EAR to JBoss AS 4.2 server.

OS: Windows XP Professional;
JDK: 1.5.0_12;
Web Tools:
2.0.0.v200706041905-42CI_kE77Y7TAMAVHH
Build id: 200706260303
It happens only for jst.ear facet 5.0, jst.ear facet 1.4 works fine.

Here is an exception that occurs during creating project with jst.ejb 5.0 facet.

I did mean jst.ear 5.0
(In reply to comment #2)
> Here is an exception that occurs during creating project with jst.ejb 5.0
> facet.

I guess this is related: http://dev.eclipse.org/mhonarc/lists/wtp-dev/msg05306.html

I wonder where the docs are for doing JEE 5 correct edits are ? 
Did WTP 2.0 actually end up having a stable API for this ?
